CPDyAna
  • SAMOS Modules
  • View page source

SAMOS Modules

The SAMOS (Statistical Analysis of MOlecular Simulations) modules provide advanced trajectory analysis capabilities for molecular dynamics simulations. These modules offer high-performance analysis tools with support for multiple file formats and statistical methods.

Overview

The SAMOS modules consist of:

  • Analysis Tools: Core statistical analysis functions for MD trajectories

  • I/O Operations: Reading and writing various trajectory formats (LAMMPS, XSF, etc.)

  • Plotting Utilities: Visualization functions for analysis results

  • Trajectory Handling: Advanced trajectory manipulation and processing

  • Utility Functions: Helper functions for common MD analysis tasks

Core Analysis Module

The main analysis module provides high-level functions for common MD analyses.

Bases: object

This class serves as the main analyzer for dynamic properties (MSD, VAF, etc)

__init__(**kwargs)[source]
get_kinetic_energies(stepsize=1, decompose_system=True, decompose_atoms=False, decompose_species=False)[source]
get_msd(decomposed=False, atom_indices=None, **kwargs)[source]

Calculates the mean square discplacement (MSD),

  1. Calculate the MSD for each block

  2. Calculate the mean and the standard deviation of the slope

  3. Calculate the conductivity, including error propagation.

Parameters:

  • decomposed (bool) – Compute the (3,3) MSD matrix by computing each Cartesian component independently.

  • species_of_interest (list) – The species of interest for which to calculate the MSD, for example [“O”, “H”]

  • atom_indices (list) – The indices of interest for which to calculate the MSD, for example [0, 1, 2, 5]. The intersection of atom_indices and species_of_interest is taken, so aotm_indices can be used to narrow the list of atoms

  • **kwargs –

    All other parameters required by DynamicsAnalyzer._get_running_params()

For this function t_start_fit_* and t_end_fit_* can also be lists/arrays. The slope and conductivities will be computed for each (t_start_fit, t_end_fit) pair.

get_power_spectrum(arrayname=None, **kwargs)[source]

Calculate the power spectrum. :param int smothening:

Smothen the power spectrum by taking a mean every N steps.

class samos_modules.samos_analysis.RDF(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: BaseAnalyzer

run(radius=None, species_pairs=None, istart=0, istop=None, stepsize=1, nbins=100)[source]

Calculate a RDF, also searching periodic images. .. todo:

Improve algorithm because it can actually fail in
very acute cell systems

TODO: Implement orthorhombic case to gain efficiency

Parameters:

  • radius (float) – The radius for the calculation of the RDF

  • istart (int) – where to start sampling

  • istop (int) – where to stop sampling (trajectory index)

  • stepsize (int) – Sampling steps to take, defaults to 1. A stepsize=10 takes every 10th step for trajectory calculation.

  • binsize (in) – Number of bins to use in histogram, defaults to 100. Increasing this means finer resolution but also more noise.

run_fort(radius=None, species_pairs=None, istart=0, istop=None, stepsize=1, nbins=100)[source]
Parameters:

radius (float) – The radius for the calculation of the RDF

class samos_modules.samos_analysis.TimeSeries(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: AttributedArray

samos_modules.samos_analysis.get_gaussian_density(trajectory, element=None, outputfile='out.xsf', sigma=0.3, n_sigma=3.0, density=0.1, istart=1, istop=None, stepsize=1, indices=None, indices_exclude_from_plot=None)[source]
Parameters:

  • positionsf (str) – Where to read the positions from.

  • pos_units (str) – The units of the positions (implemented so far: angstrom, bohr).

  • outputfile (str) – The xsf outputfile

  • with_symbols (bool) – Whether symbols are printed in front of positions (will be ignored)

  • cell (list) – the 3x3 cell,

  • element (str) – The to calculate the density for, has to be present in symbols

  • nat (int) – The number of atoms written in the positionsfile per atomic step

  • sigma (float) – The gaussian broadening to apply

  • n_sigma (float) – the multiple of sigma for which to create the bounding box.

  • density (float) – The density for the grid

  • istart (int) – Index to start reading positions

  • istop (int) – Index to stop reading positions

  • recenter (bool) – Whether to recenter

  • samos_modules.samos_analysis.util_rdf_and_plot(): Radial Distribution Function analysis

  • samos_modules.samos_analysis.write_xsf_header(): XSF file writing utilities

I/O Operations Module

Handles reading and writing of various trajectory and data formats.

samos_modules.samos_io.get_indices(header_list, prefix='', postfix='')[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.get_position_indices(header_list)[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.get_thermo_props(fname)[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.pos_2_absolute(cell, pos, postype)[source]

Transforming positions to absolute positions

samos_modules.samos_io.read_lammps_dump(filename, elements=None, elements_file=None, types=None, timestep=None, mass_types=None, thermo_file=None, thermo_pe=None, thermo_stress=None, save_extxyz=False, outfile=None, ignore_forces=False, ignore_velocities=False, skip=0, f_conv=1.0, e_conv=1.0, s_conv=1.0, additional_keywords_dump=[], quiet=False, istep=1)[source]

Read a filedump from lammps. It expects atomid to be printed, and positions to be given in scaled or unwrapped coordinates :param filename: lammps dump file to read :param elements: list of elements to use :param elements_file:

file containing elements (separated by space), instead of elements

Parameters:

  • types – list of types if elements are not specified and type is a column

  • timestep – timestep of dump (in fs)

  • thermo_file – file containing thermo output in case required

  • thermo_pe – potential energy column in thermo file (as given in header)

  • thermo_stress – stress column in thermo file (as given in header, will do the _xx/_yy etc)

  • save_extxyz – save to extxyz file (or if outfile is given with .extxyz)

  • outfile – output file name, will write trajectory by default

  • ignore_forces – ignore forces even if written in dump

  • ignore_velocities – ignore velocities even if written in dump

  • skip – skip first n steps

  • f_conv – force conversion factor

  • e_conv – energy conversion factor

  • s_conv – stress conversion factor

  • additional_keywords_dump – additional keywords to be added read form dump and to be added as array. The column name is used both as key but also as arrayname

samos_modules.samos_io.read_positions_with_ase(filename)[source]

Reads all frames from a trajectory file using ASE and returns a numpy array of shape (nsteps, natoms, 3).

samos_modules.samos_io.read_step_info(lines, lidx=0, start=False, additional_kw=[], quiet=False)[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.read_xsf(filename, fold_positions=False)[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.write_grid(data, outfilename=None, vals_per_line=5)[source]
samos_modules.samos_io.write_xsf(atoms, positions, cell, data, vals_per_line=6, outfilename=None, is_flattened=False, shape=None)[source]

Supported Formats

  • LAMMPS Dump Files: samos_modules.samos_io.read_lammps_dump()

  • XSF Files: samos_modules.samos_io.read_xsf(), samos_modules.samos_io.write_xsf()

  • Trajectory Formats: Support for ASE-compatible formats

Plotting Module

Visualization and plotting utilities for analysis results.

Compiled Extensions

The SAMOS modules include several compiled extensions for high-performance calculations:

  • gaussian_density.pyd: Gaussian density calculations

  • mdutils.pyd: MD utility functions

  • rdf.pyd: Optimized RDF calculations

These compiled modules provide significant performance improvements for computationally intensive operations.

Usage Examples

Basic MSD Analysis with SAMOS

from samos_modules.samos_analysis import util_msd

# Calculate MSD for Li ions
util_msd(
    trajectory_path='trajectory.extxyz',
    stepsize=1,
    species=['Li'],
    plot=True,
    savefig='msd_li.png',
    t_start_fit_ps=5,
    t_end_fit_ps=50
)

RDF Calculation and Plotting

from samos_modules.samos_analysis import util_rdf_and_plot

# Compute and plot RDF for Li-O pairs
util_rdf_and_plot(
    trajectory_path='trajectory.extxyz',
    radius=8.0,
    stepsize=1,
    bins=200,
    species_pairs=['Li-O', 'Li-Li'],
    plot=True,
    savefig='rdf_analysis.png'
)

Reading LAMMPS Trajectories

from samos_modules.samos_io import read_lammps_dump

# Read LAMMPS dump file and convert to trajectory
traj = read_lammps_dump(
    filename='dump.lammpstrj',
    elements=['Li', 'Al', 'P', 'S'],
    timestep=0.001,  # ps
    save_extxyz=True,
    outfile='converted.extxyz'
)
